p: A total of 634 households with 2175 persons were enrolled, of which 488 (77.0%) households participated in the follow-up visit. From 170 pig-keeping households, 373 (61.9%) participants were enrolled, of which 204 (54.7%) had a follow-up visit. From 464 non-pig-keeping households, 764 (48.6%) participants were enrolled, of which 421 (55.1%) had a follow-up visit (Fig. 2). The average number of participants enrolled per household was 2.2 and 1.7 for pig-keeping and non-pig-keeping households, respectively. There were no significant differences in sex, age, or education level completed of household heads between the pig-keeping and non-pig-keeping households.
